channel.title: The yankee dollar
channel.description:
A documentary series on impact of U.S. dollar on Latin America, especially Mexico. Ther series is hosted by Richard Arellano.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Alliance for progress
item.description: This program explores an aid program called the Alliance for Progress. The guest is Franklin Gilland, Industrial Program, AID, Mexico City.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R.C.
item.dc:subject: Mexico--Foreign economic relations--United States.

item.title: Federal dollar
item.description: This program explores the influx of money from the American government that has provided to Mexico. Guests are: Jesus Rivero Quijano, director general, Center of Industrial Productivity, Mexico City; Robert Spriegel and Bernard Sord, University of Texas.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R.C.
item.dc:subject: Mexico--Foreign economic relations--United States.

item.title: Capital investment, part one
item.description: This program focuses on capital investment in Mexico. The program's guest is Jerry Dresser, Capital Development Officer, Mexico City Mission, AID.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R.C.
item.dc:subject: Mexico--Foreign economic relations--United States.

item.title: Student dollar
item.description: This program explores the economic impact of American students coming to Mexico. Guests are: Dr. D. Ray Lindley; Dr. Richard E. Greenleaf; and Dr. Melvin E. McMichael, all of Mexico City College.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R.C.
item.dc:subject: Mexico--Foreign economic relations--United States.

item.title: Tourism
item.description: This program focuses on American tourism in Mexico. Guests include Don Ricardo Estada Berg, managing director, Mexican Tourist Association; and Ernst Leurnberger, manager, Chalet Swiss Restaurant.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R.C.
item.dc:subject: Tourism--Mexico--History.

item.title: U.S. aid in Mexico
item.description: This program focuses on U.S. aid to Mexico. Guests are A. Evans Birdwell, U of Texas, interviewed in Mexico City; and William Dommermuth, University of Texas.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R.C.
item.dc:subject: Mexico--Foreign economic relations--United States.

item.title: Capital development
item.description: This program focuses on American federal money going in to Mexico to aid in development. Guests are: William Rogers, director, Regional Technical Aid Center for Latin America, Mexico City; and John W. Johnston, Jr., director, AID, Mexico City.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R.C.
item.dc:subject: Mexico--Foreign economic relations--United States.

item.title: Capital investment, part two
item.description: This program continues the focus on capital investment in Mexico. Guests are Edward Drees, president, American Hospital Supply Company International, Mexico City; and Dr. Ernest W. Walker, University of Texas.
item.dc:creator: Norris, R.C.
item.dc:subject: Mexico--Foreign economic relations--United States.
